unit.title: Final Review & Test Readiness
objectives: Reinforce the most-missed topics: right-of-way, signs/markings, speed/space, and special situations.
Apply test-taking strategies: careful reading, eliminating distractors, and time management.
Prepare required documents and logistics for the DMV knowledge test.
Adopt a safe driving mindset beyond the test: maturity, responsibility, and continuous learning.

sections.title: Test-Taking Strategies
sections.summary: Score higher by reading carefully and using logic.

content.text: Read the entire question, predict the answer, and eliminate clearly wrong choices. Watch for absolutes like 'always' or 'never'.

items: Look for key phrases (yield, no passing, reduced speed).
Use common sense; safety-first answers often win.
If you don't know, eliminate and make your best choice.

content.text: Pace yourself. If stuck, mark and return. Use breathing techniques to stay calm and focused.

items: Don't rush the first questions.
Double-check flagged items at the end.
Hydrate and rest beforehand.

sections.title: Most-Missed Topics: Quick Recap
sections.summary: Review tricky areas with concise reminders.

content.text: Yield to pedestrians in crosswalks, to vehicles already in the intersection, and to the right at 4-way stops when arriving simultaneously.

items: Unprotected lefts yield to oncoming traffic.
Right turn on red only if allowed and after full stop.
Always check for bikes and scooters.

content.text: Know regulatory vs. warning signs. Respect solid/double lines, and maintain safe following distance appropriate to speed and conditions.

items: Yellow signs = warnings; white/red = regulations.
Solid double lines: no passing.
Increase following distance in rain/darkness.

content.text: Bring required identification, application receipts, and any forms specified by your DMV appointment confirmation.

items: Verify appointment time and location.
Confirm any consent/guardian forms if you are a minor.
Check current DMV guidance for acceptable IDs.

content.text: Understand retake policies and waiting periods. If you don’t pass, review missed topics before trying again.

items: Review your weak areas immediately.
Schedule retakes according to policy.
Continue practicing defensive driving habits.

sections.title: Responsible Driving Mindset
sections.summary: Drive like lives depend on you—because they do.

content.text: Real driving is more than passing a test; it requires restraint, patience, and respect for others.

items: Avoid peer pressure and show-offs.
Never drive impaired or overly tired.
Plan ahead—routes, weather, and time.

content.text: Commit to lifelong learning: refresh the handbook, practice new skills, and keep your vehicle maintained.

items: Sign a personal safe driving pledge.
Review this course’s summaries quarterly.
Teach peers safe habits—be a role model.
